description:
3.5 stars. Pretty good for being open late night.

The slice is freakin huge, which is good, but it didn't taste strongly of any flavor, so it was slightly underwhelming.

I think I would go here again though, because they are very nice, and open late, and hey, it's pizza.

For me, crust is a bit too crunchy/bland, and sauce needs a bit more salt. But it's not bad.
author: Auza A.

description:
I was admittedly a little hesitant to visit this establishment based on the reviews I've seen, but the power of a late night pizza crave one night provided enough activation energy to have me walking at a brisk pace to the shop. The location seems a little intimidating, but being a block from Mission Street at least ensured that it was well within a populated area, depending on the time of day of course. Anyway, getting to the food, I was surprised to see that the slices were individually made, a true rarity in today's mostly mass produced pizza pies found at other locations.

I ordered a pepperoni slice, which set me back a mere 4.50, an astonishing deal which cannot be matched in the ever gentrifying neighborhood that the Mission is becoming. Mind you, this slice in fact is 2 slices of a large pizza, so it is quite the bargain. Fresh pizza cannot be underestimated. The dough is quite good. It has lovely airiness, enough crunch, and offers enough structural integrity for the delicious sauce to instill confidence in the eater. The mozzarella cheese gives enough saltiness without overpowering the rest, while the pepperoni provides the kick I was craving. These flavors, combined with a piping hot temperature, resulted in an extremely satisfying experience. To be honest with you, I was quite shocked at how great this slice was.

To update from a present day's perspective, I have since visited Supreme Pizza 3 times, and ordered online to expedite the process. It took around 10 minutes for my order to be ready. I heartily recommend this shop for your quick pizza needs, though I will add a disclaimer that I have yet to expand on the rest of the menu. Time will tell if I will choose to forego my usual pepperoni slice, but I will certain update my review if I do so. I'm curious to see how a whole pie will perform, and am wondering about the non pizza items as well. For now though, Supreme Pizza is in my opinion, the King of Mission pizza.
author: Daniel E K.

description: Had low expectations initially but is now one of my favorite spots in the city! Massive slices and amazing crunch! Highly recommended
author: Seth K.

description:
This is by far one of the best local SF delivery pizzerias I've tried thus far, and I've tried quite a few in the city.

I ordered the cheese 12", and it was just perfect. 
The cheese was deliciously cooked, and the sauce, oh the sauce of course, made the pizza. It was tangy, tomatoey delici. Nicely done. Got a little side of ranch, they serve Ken's ranch. If you fellow ranch aficionados know, is decent ranch.
author: Shruti D.

description:
They are open pretty late, which is nice because when I get hungry at night, I can count on being able to come here and get something to eat. The pizza slices are huge, and for about ~$4 you can get a rather big slice of pizza.

There's nothing amazingly exceptional about the pizza, but it is still a solid pizza that hits the craving for a low price, and it tastes pretty fresh and is hot when you get it.
author: Tyler T.

description: I ordered a slice and a salad. The salad cost about five bucks and filled up a huge dinner plate. The slice was cut into two made fresh and was huge. It was a good if huge meal. Yet there was no futbol on TV, which bothered me quite a bit! Guess you can't have it all.
author: Mace W.

description: Not from the city and didn't feel like driving for lunch so I ordered Supreme Pizza for delivery. Man there service is quick which I was surprised with all the traffic around us. Couldn't be more happy by choosing them for my lunch option. I would highly recommend them if your trying to get pizza delivered or dinning in
author: Will D.

description:
San Franciscan pizza! Delicious and the slices are huge!! I ordered the XL San Franciscan pizza to go and you won't believe how big the slices where. 

Lots of green peppers, pepperonis, mushrooms and meats! Took my first bite and it was amazing especially while its still hot. Loved the meats! Why? The meats were huge and delicious! 

I'm definitely coming back when I'm in the Mission!
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
Reliable and good pizza.  Seems that downtown has a shortage of both when you need them in a pinch and we've called on Supreme Pizza about six times.

We always seem to order the San Francisco style minus the mushrooms and honestly have never been disappointed.  The crust is a slightly chewy hand tossed style and the toppings are in the right proportion for the size of the pizza.  They pay attention to the notes you write on the order and don't mess it up, so they should probably get the extra star just for that! 

Delivery time seems to always be earlier than quoted as well.  They make ordering easy through Yelp and Eat24, which give you tracking options. (Appreciated!)

All in all, you can't go wrong with Supreme Pizza, trust them to deliver a great pie!!
author: Diana W.

description: I have no complaints about the delivery even if it was a four blocks away. In less that 30 minutes, food was delivered.  However, my pizza's crust was so thick on the edges and so thin going middle. Toppings were so few near the edges and almost everything was at the middle. I also ordered what everyone here was talking about, their chocolate cheesecake. Apparently, didn't work for me as I tasted Oreo and the use of gelatin and both overpowered for my taste. I like the free sodas though, guess that covers the three stars.
author: Kat P.

description:
This review is just for the slices.

They are massive and basically individual sized pizzas. Ordered a while back with a friend and we got cheese, combo and a slice with bacon and veggies. Everything was great! I love pizza crust so I loved that the slices have crust all around. 

The grated cheese packets were clumpy/old so no bueno but besides that the pizza was delicious! Highly recommend!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
This is my go to spot when I want quick, inexpensive food in the Mission that's not a couple tacos. The slices are massive and there are so many yummy options, including pesto. They also make yummy salads that are also very affordable. 

The pizza and salads aren't the best I've ever had, but the value and quality for the price makes this spot a winner.
author: Marguerite C.

description: Life savor! 5 stars alone just for accommodating my hunger needs at 3am! In addition to excellent customer service and mouthwatering slices. Can't go wrong with traditional pepperoni. It wasn't too greasy and super crispy. Although it was delivered, it felt like it was fresh out of the oven. Thank you!
author: Sahar N.

description: Supreme pizza is a true slap in the face for true born and bred mission residents. The customer service here and I use the word serivice lightly is an act of true disrespect to the hispanic community. While being told to wait after I was already first in line they rather take the order of not one but three caucasains tech scum. This pizza might have been the greatest culinary creation in the history of pizza, or made from rat cheese I will never know. The reason for this being they rather bow down to the new invaders of the mission because tech caucasain money is some how worth more than mine....
author: Rudy M.

description: This place gets 2 stars for making somewhat decent slices of pizza. But other then that the pastas and sides that they have here are just plain disgusting. The pastas are clearly microwaved or baked in a foil pan because they just look and taste bad. If you can't make decent pastas then don't serve them.
author: Mohammad A.

description:
Honestly, I probably wouldn't come here as often if I wasn't able to use Eat24 to order, pay, and then go pickup my slice on the way back home. Not to say I wouldn't still eat here, just probably not often enough to become Duke.

The slices are all made fresh, as in they arrange the dough into a slice of pizza, put the toppings on and then put it in the oven. Personally, I'm a fan of this as the edges get a little bit of a crust, but others might not. There's a huge variety of slices available, in addition to being able to customize your own. The TV inside is nice to distract you while you wait for your pizza, most times I've gone in there has been a Warriors game on.

The staff are really friendly, I would suggest checking them out if you're ever in the Mission.
author: Rajeev S.

description: Reasonably priced delivery pizza and tasty. Crust is on thick side but they put plenty of cheese and the sauce is delicious.
author: A M.

description: Pizza has the best flavor in town. I ate at a few pizza spots around Mission, including the higher end pizza spots, but this is my favorite. Slices are made to order, not warmed, and the slices are humongous. Must try.
author: Mikey F.

description: I would never order food from this restaurant. They are a party of a company called ordering.com. The take orders and never delivery them. They charge your car and then argue with you and threaten you when you call to question them. The only company I would say that is worse then them is the company that gave me there info to deal with them. Don't order from them or you will be sorry. Not getting your food after waiting for over an hour is the worst service I have ever heard of.
author: Spencer T.

description:
My friend ordered a slice of pie from the fridge and there was mold on it. It really turned my stomach and now I don't trust their food.

Edit: owner replied calling me a liar.  It was pie from the fridge now a pizza. You'd think a good resturaunt owner would be more concerned that they served moldy food than calling his own customers a liar. Never coming back
author: Chris B.

description:
This place local for me, and I love it. Great, fresh fast and affordable. 
Always friendly on the phone & friendly delivery people as well.
author: Coco F.

description: This single slice of pizza was WAYYYYYY bigger than I had expected!!!! For only $4.90, you get a slice of pizza that is almost equal to an individual small sized pizza!!! This was the perfect way to end my night of Über driving!!! I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Alex C.

description: My first time trying Supreme and I got a mess you call a pizza. One star for it arriving still hot and another for taste. But really? I really hope this isn't how the pizzas are usually delivered. The pizza was obviously on its side for a while before being delivered and even leaked through the box. Half the pizza didn't even have toppings because they all slid to one side! I had high hopes for delivery based on previous reviews but will not use Supreme again.
author: Lydia F.

description: This pizza was fantastic! Delivery was quick, 30min or less. Pizza tasted homemade, fresh, delicious, and was hot! Didn't come with napkins or spices/cheese, but was too good to really care :) Will def be ordering from here again!
author: Lilly C.

description: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! Brought wrong pizza!! Wouldn't do anything about it. Said they got it right and my app says it doesn't!
author: Meg P.

description:
This is the only pizza that delivers near me in the city that I can trust for quality, delivery, and price. Being a New Yorker, pizza is a staple in my weekly routine.

Great staff, always super friendly, never a long wait, and a very large XL (feeds 4+ easily).

Toppings are great and they'll even make you a custom slice! Been a weekly repeat customer here for 2.5 years and have never had a bad experience.
author: Alex K.

description:
CANNOT GET BAD TASTE OUTTA MY MOUTH

I order pizza every coupla months or so, and decided to try Supreme Pizza.

This was, without any doubt, the WORST pizza I've had in many, many years.

I still cannot get the flavor out of my mouth. It was so bad, I threw most of it away. So bad, I wondered about its preparation.

The main issue is a saline flavor, like some...not gonna say it. Let's say it's salty like a mouthful of seawater is salty.

Others seem to like it, so what's up?

Whatever the case: Tonight, it was the absolute worst, from flavor to texture to preparation. Terrible, bad, no-good pizza.

Blech.
author: Kirk K.

description: Believe it or not, finding a good pizza delivery place that's relatively affordable is really rough in this city. I've tried about eight places and Supreme hits the mark when it comes to quality, cost and convenience. My standard go-to is a large 16" Hawaiian pie with bacon added to it, which costs around 27 bucks including delivery, tip and two free cans of soda. Their pizza is straight up California style with a medium crust that isn't crispy, and the cheese and toppings are generous but not overdone. It's definitely not Marcello's, but Supreme still hits the spot when you don't wanna leave the apartment!
author: Doug V.

description: Boyfriend and I I definitely got food poisoning from a Hawaiian pizza we ordered from here. This was all we had to eat that day and both ended up sick in the bathroom. Also the delivery driver told us he was outside but he was at the wrong address. Pizza itself wasn't great, crust tasted like cardboard.
author: Tina R.

description: Surprisingly way better than expected. The pizza is bomb, and so is that Greek Calzone. My new favorite pizza place for delivery.
author: Ryan D.

description:
Excellent pizza.  We were staying overnight in the City and found Supreme Pizza here on yelp and I was very happy.  Had delivered to hotel while we watched the Cowboy playoff game (they lost BOO)...

We ordered a large, half meat for hubby and half veggie for me - thin crust.  My husband only likes thin crust.  I thought it was great but hubby didn't think we got the thin crust.  It seemed thin to me but I've had thinner crust pizza..  

At any rate - it was delish - even better than the place we go to all the time by our house that we love.  I'd totally order from them again if in the area.
author: Annette P.

description: Very good pizza, and cheesecake.  Great service too. Give Supreme Pizza a try when you're in The Mission.
author: L J.

description: I ordered delivery. It came much quicker than I thought it would. And the food is truly delicioso! Pricing is very reasonable, as well.
author: Mark F.

description:
Who of you would not order a small pizza to yourself after laying in bed all day with a terribly sore throat? For some reason, the homemade Tom Yum I had been nomming on all day left me feeling empty, and emptiness requires pizza. To myself. On a Friday night. 

I searched for a bit on Yelp before landing on Supreme. Not wanting to spend more than $15 on myself for a meal, I figured this pizza would last for more than one meal so it was a good purchase. Ordering was easy thanks to Yelp's online ordering, and my pizza arrived after about 30 minutes. $12.88 total, plus I tipped the guy as I raspily thanked him. 

The pizza was great. Simple and honest, and a great companion to me and my cat Will as we finished up season two of Orange is the New Black (take that, V!). Lots of flavorful sauce, plenty of cheese and peperoni. It actually made my throat feel a lot better, which I thought was weird, since pizza is not a broth-based substance (shock!). And I had enough leftover for the rest of the weekend and even for lunch yesterday and today. I'm a fan and will surely be back.
author: Crystal C.

description:
I really love this pizza place. We always get the medium Hawaiian pizza, and it seriously is the best pizza I have had in this city!!! It's a perfect version of, what I call, a pizza slice place. ( I categorize pizza places in either authentic Italian or Pizza slice place, like New York Pizza )

We used to be "big fans" of Patxi's, but they seem to always mess up the order or be really late. Then we were Déjà-vu fans, but Suprême has been the best for the last few months, fo sho!!
author: Styn V.

description:
I have ordered from this place a few times with Eat24 and I haven't been disappointed yet.  The one thing that stands out with their pizza is the dough and you notice it immediately.   It's a softer, thicker dough than usual.   Kinda like North Beach Pizza type thickness.   The flavors and toppings are great.   The right amount of sauce in my opinion with both their red and white sauce pizzas.

We usually order whole pies but one time my niece was over and we ordered her a couple cheese pizza slices,  just in case 1 wasn't enough.  We were quite surprised at how big the 2 slices were...looked like 40% of a medium size whole pizza from what I remember.  They even cut it into 4 smaller slices to be manageable. So if you have reservations about their single slice sizes,  don't worry.

I've tried one of their pastas and it was decent.  Garlic bread is good and their dessert cakes are what you expect to them to be and taste like as they are most likely bought from the same place as other pizza places like Restaurant Depot for example.  Solid stuff.
author: Gilbert C.

description: Pizza here is okay. Not the best not the worst. My only real complaint is the cheese used is slightly on the saltier side. The amount if toppings used is not bad as well.
author: Michael M.

description:
My bf and I were really craving pizza on a late Tuesday night and were to lazy to make it out of fidi (aka restaurants open even remotely close to us) so we desperately searched Yelp and came across Supreme Pizza - best decision we made all week. 

The pizza was surprisingly SO much better than usual pizza delivery spots - the pizza arrived in ~25 minutes, still hot and full of toppings (none of the usual skimping on toppings at other spots). 

The pizza was thick and filling, and held over well until the next days lunch. For $25 we got a large pizza & salad - totally worth our late night cravings.
author: Anu P.

description:
The pizzas here are simple, tasty and satisfying. We ordered a garden veggie pizza large (for $20 odd bucks) and it easily served four hungry souls with a couple of slices leftover. I wonder how long their extra-large would last!

The pizza itself was decent, with good amount of cheese and selected toppings. However, I did miss chilli flakes and oregano topping sachets in the box.  The crust could have been better, but otherwise a decent (not extraordinarily delicious) inexpensive meal option.
author: Rohan R.

description:
I didnt like how they treatthe custumer.
I arrived at the place and I asked to go to restroom they said it was just for customer. But I hadn't ordered yet.
They should learn treat customer!!!
author: Guilherme R.

description: I ordered through grubhub.com and I was annoyed at first because the website didn't update to tell me the status of delivery. But the food came and it was good, I got a huge slice of pizza, garden salad and a slice of chocolate cake delivered for $17. So worth it to me rather than dealing with driving in the city. The cake is more like a chocolate mousse, not cake, it was very good, but if you want actual cake it's not for you.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Got a groupon deal for this place Ordered half combo and half 4 cheeses XL 18". The pizza was quite good I must say and didn't skimp off the toppings. Sauce was good and the crust was perfect. 

Saw a guy ordered a slice a pizza and from the reviewers on yelp they ain't never lied. The slices were huge!!!

Check em out!! You can't go wrong for some good pizza for a hangover cure or got the munchies.
author: Cee M.

description:
this place is great! i'm a local in the neighborhood, and this is my to go pizza place. 

Supreme has plenty of combination pizza options which are great. They accommodate vegetarians,meat lovers and the in-betweeners with their great salad options.

I commend Supreme Pizza with their AMAZING price for their GIGANTIC SLICES! The taste and quality is there too. This is why Supreme Pizza is my Misson Neighborhood Pizza Restaurant.
author: Mere S.

description:
Best pizza I've had since leaving NJ/NYC

I had the barbecue chicken and the plain pizza. I SERIOUSLY recommend it. I'll be happy if I can come back to S.F. again and have it before going out.
author: Sino O.

description: Slices are huge and yummy. Prices are reasonable for their sizes! Would recommend this place to any pizza lover. They made my slice fresh right after I ordered, nice job guys.
author: Priscilla S.

description:
Tried them for the first time. I'm a small business owner so I like to patronize small pizza joints...Got an extra large meat lovers.....$30 out the door.
It was good, just expected something extra.
author: Jeffrey V.

description:
This review is specifically for a lunch delivery order.

I work in a neighborhood with very few restaurants that are within walking distance.  Many other places that offer delivery around here require a $25.00 minimum, and since it was just me, I opted to try Supreme Pizza.

The portions are huge!  The pizza isn't too greasy nor salty, and they are generous with toppings.  I also ordered a salad and the veggies were fresh, crisp and croutons were crunchy, unlike some places that keep soggy salads in the fridge all week.  

There's nothing particularly unique about this place, but it's a good choice if you want something simple, quick and tasty to satisfy pizza cravings!
author: Kelly S.

description:
After a long day/night at OSL, my girlfriends and I were crazy craving for dinner and after several attempts for pizza delivery (which all said it would take at least an hour to deliver), Supreme Pizza came to our rescue and delivered our order within 30 minutes! Score.

Our order included a half hawaiian half pepperoni pizza, chicken wings, and 2 liters of soda... all for about $25. The pizza was fresh and good, as well as the chicken wings. The delivery guy was very nice and polite... one of the nicest I've seen in a while! You don't see great customer service every day.

Overall, we had a good experience with Supreme Pizza... good food, good price. Thanks for covering our order on short notice and taking care of us!
author: Felicia L.

description:
Really nice, big cheesy pizza slices (I had the Margarita).  The slices look look more real/authentic than other pizza slices I've seen in other pizza restaurants... 

Open late at night.  TV inside.
author: Roni K.

description: The other day I was really hungry and I had lunch at supreme pizza and to my surprise my pizza was really good and for the price of it was really big piece you looking for lunch with just a nice pizza whether it's meat or vegetarian it's nice place to go. Ck out the mission supreme pizza
author: Richard O.

description: Ordered from this place for an easy night in on a Thursday.  2 hours later, no sign of the food.  Called the restaurant when they were 30 minutes late and they responded that the order would arrive in 30, 45-60, and 20 minutes all within the span of the call.  Seems like they've taken their phone off the hook now.
author: Dave G.

description: I got my order delivered. I was first really impressed with how fast it came (within 30 minutes) and I thought the Caesar salad was good but basic. But then I had the San Franciscan calzone. I took a couple of bites and I was immediately unimpressed. Maybe twenty minutes later I felt sick to my stomach. I could no longer  eat the calzone because I knew that was the reason for my upset stomach. What a waste of 20 bucks.
author: Mikaela B.

description: Just an FYI... recently walked in and ordered wings and mozzarella sticks (on top of slices) for take out... got the slices right away as usual, but then waited almost 25 minutes for the wings... not okay, especially since our slices were stone cold by that time. moreover, the wings aren't fried, they're baked... changes the texture, flavor, and experience. will not order wings or mozzarella again (unless they get a deep fryer) - they just weren't good. but will def continue to come back for the pizza.
author: David F.

description:
Just the facts:
Ordered - Pizza and 2 toppings, Caesar salad and a Coke.

I tipped 20% via Eat24

Deliveryman refused to bring my order to my door, there is an elevator in my building but I am unable to walk due to an injury/surgery. luckily my friend was here and ran outside for me. 

What was delivered - Just the pizza with the toppings split so one side had olives the other half had meat and garlic bread. 

I called and reported the problems - Supreme Pizza offered to make a correct pizza and to send the salad & soda. I declined the pizza only. It was a fair solution.

The delivery man arrived with the salad & soda, he was very rude and would not bring the order to my door. 

Those are the facts of my experience with Supreme Pizza. 

I won't order from them again.
author: Jay R.

description:
Supreme Pizza is sneaky.  The pizza is either immemorably mediocre or slightly bad.  It's never really good.  It's never horrible.  The delivery is fine.  The price is OK.

I often look at my Pizzas of San Francisco list and wonder why I haven't reviewed Supreme Pizza yet.  Then I remember that I can't remember whether the pizza is any good.  Then I try it, and I remember forgetting exactly how I forgot I felt the last three times I remember trying it.  And you know what?  I forget to review it.

So here's the review, finally.  I remembered this time.  Let's hope you don't forget it.
author: John S.

description: the staff was so super friendly and the place was clean and a lovely stop for lunch. i got a slice of cheese ($3.15 - Great price for this city!!) and it was a hearty slice. Excellent crust. I only gave 3 stars tho bc the cheese was a little...off. I'm not sure if the slice was fresh, but the cheese started to work like a blanket, ya know, when it all comes off together. I had a wonderful experience tho overall.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
Unfortunately I Got food poisoned here :(

On the bright side everything tasted good going down....

I had the mission calzone and garlic bread.
author: Diandra J.

description:
I like that the place is well kept, bright paint colors and just one bit of graffiti etched into glass on a mirror inside.   

i liked the rock radio station that greeted us while we ordered (and the cook changed when his long-haired co-hort went outside for a smoke).

GIANT spilices of pizza! I enjoyed my chicken and artichoke.

Close to BART.
author: Artemis X.

description: I haven't been here in a while and I definitely enjoyed the pizza! The slices are big, thin crust and fresh ingredients. The prices are okay, although I wish they wouldn't charge for every little thing.
author: Cessy C.

description:
I will be honest and say that I tried Supreme pizza by default. I work in a really busy office and I use Eat24 because they bring my deliveries to me and I dont have to leave. what was enticing to me was that Supreme didnt charge a delivery Fee, and they only had a min. of $10 for Delivery (in SoMa, where everyone is asking for 25-45 to consider delivering your food!) So I was ecstatic to find that they werent requiring too much, and they even had GREAT prices. ok, it honestly made me think it was going to be Sub-par, butttttt...

I ordered a San Francisco Pizza Slice, a Salad, and a Huge snapple and it was like 13 with Tax. First of all, my food came FAST, I'm going to say in like 20-25 minutes! It was still HOT, and it was GOOD, like really GOOD. Plus my "Slice" was Huge! It was 2 pieces, that were cooked as one pizza, it was larger than a small pizza at a chain pizza place. The salad was fresh and crisp and everything was clearly washed and preat.

Listen, if you are looking for some Froo froo, gourmet pizza, then this isn't it. This is good (really good) freshly baked, pizza. The toppings were awesome, and the crust was good and it was a great value and a really good quality product. Me and my co workers have decided this is our go to place for lunch from now on.

Quick, Amazing prices, and a lot of Food, plus it really is Good. You can not beat that! the only reason I didnt give them 5 stars is because its just "regular" pizza but if thats what you're looking for. then this is for you! I'm a regular chick, I like normal, uncomplicated, good food without a lot of extras. Oh and they have some great combinations of pizza or just make your own! 

Love them!
author: Monique C.

description: this is my spot! love this place....delicious pizza, great price and they always deliver earlier than expected!!
author: This Is M E.

description:
Well, my delivery driver showed up more than an hour late.  He called me to say he was here 15 minutes before he was actually here.  When he got here, he swore at me, refused to explain why he didn't call until he was half an hour late, was unrepentant about the service problem or his attitude problem.  "Do you want the food or not?" and he reached for the already-paid-for food.

When I told him that he couldn't have the food unless he gave me my money back, he started walking away.  I said "sir, we're not done here."  He turns around, walks uncomfortably close, and starts wagging his hand in my face.  Swears at me some more.  Tells me I should call the owner of the restaurant.  I tell him I plan to, and what's his name?

He walks away, middle finger held high in the air.  So, I call EatStreet, then I call the restaurant.

Well now he's picking up the phones, and he pauses before giving his first name.  Also, now it turns out (he claims) that *he* is the owner of the restaurant!  And there's nobody to talk to but him in the middle of the day.

No accommodation for the extremely late, ice cold food.  Not allowed to take the tip-on-credit-card back.  No accommodation for being sworn at for politely asking for an explanation.  No accommodation for getting a finger waved in my face.

I feel like a fool for recommending these people twice; once today.

Avoid at any cost.  Don't order from here if they pay you to take it.
author: John H.

description: Huge slice, tasty sauce, just enough grease, and reasonably priced, this is a very good neighborhood pizza shop!
author: Brian G.

description: Had a pizza delivered. Seemed like they reheated a pizza they had lying around.
author: Michael G.

description: This pizza is disgusting. The food was cold and honestly I'm not sure it was healthy to eat. The delivery guy was super aggressive and swore at me when I complained about how late the food was.
author: William L.

description:
Tonight, I ordered from Supreme Pizza and had a not-so-great experience. 

When the order was delivered, the delivery person had forgotten our drinks and Caesar salad dressing. I contacted the driver, his number was in my phone as he'd just called to have me come downstairs to pickup the food. He returned about 15 minutes later with the sodas, but still no salad dressing. When I asked for the dressing, he said they were out. Hmmm, so why sell a salad if you have no dressing??

So after paying and tipping (I ordered through Eat24.com), I still had to run to the closest convenience store (and by convenience, I mean $$) to purchase a bottle of dressing for $5. All told, my $50-pizza experience was not great. 

Pizza was good though...
author: Anthony B.

description: Ordered online without ever having been there. They had a decent selection of topping and the prices were average. The order came quickly and the pizza was delicious. I recommend Supreme Pizza if you don't know where to order from.
author: Jon G.

description: Wonderful pizza, and they were incredibly sensitive to my dairy allergy. My only "complaint" is that the pizza wasn't warm when it got to me (I had it delivered), but the flavor was still delicious.
author: Frank A.

description: The calzone had no good ingredients. The roasted peppers tasted bottled. Pretty bad.
author: Kabir K.

description:
I went in for "a slice" and got basically a good-sized personal pizza, formed in the shape of a 12" long triangle. It was outstandingly yummy, with super fresh toppings, generous cheese, good sauce and a crust so crispy it cracked. I tried it again tonight with friends, and it was just the same quality, crispy, tasty pie.

The employees all seemed nice and were quite helpful. I enjoyed it with a Mexican coke and a slice of tasty tiramisu. 100% recommend.
author: Sarah F.

description: Oven baked slices hot to order with great topping choices and a generous interpretation of the word slice. Casual atmosphere with a few tables and space to eat at the bar. I have never regretted coming here when I'm hungry and feeling some delicious hot cheesy goodness. My favorite is the Pesto Delight which comes with feta, broccoli, and sundried tomatoes and spinach.
author: Katie K.

description: Here t I get a fat slice. The employee is nic we and helpful.  They love what they do... and it shows.... there employees are good to each other and they are happy people. And that means I will get a happy and delicious pizza
author: Angela F.

description: Our first time ordering pizza here. We order large combination and Hawaiian. I was so happy when the pizza came,  tried the combination it was so much tomato sauce not barely any cheese and it is suppose to a combination where is the vegetables and different meat? Then I tried the Hawaiian it was so horrible it was bland. This is not a good place to get pizza. Your better off eating frozen pizza(digioron)  is way better.
author: Hoa T.

description: The pizza is simple, but good. The portions are very large and the prices are cheap. There is a picture of Michael Jackson on the wall.
author: John B.

description:
see Pizza Town, one in the same. Watch out for their take out service. dough is bad. Rush job... they won't tell you they are one in the same...


Don't do it, walk somewhere to pick up your order. I don't know how businesses stay in business in this City? No such thing as quality food or service. Hey, maybe I should open a restaurant and thrive....
author: Edgar M.

description: Ordered a pizza, breadsticks, buffalo wings, and got free garlic bread. I feel the pictures look way better than the food that arrived. Everything tastes like frozen food you bought at the frozen food section and they just microwaved it. Order took forever to get here. You're better off with little cesars
author: Frances B.

description: Was perfect last time after their mistake lets always order from here they are understanding and always doing their best lets see what they have in store for us
author: Kyle M.

description:
I've been looking for a new defacto pizza place that'll deliver in the mission for a while and it looks like I found it. 

If you're looking for fancy italian pizza with fresh ingredients go to Delfina, if you want deep dish go to Little Star, but if you want just a nice thin (not nyc thin) pizza with decent ingredients Supreme is your choice. The pizza base is thin but not too thick, the ranch pizza option is delicious btw.

Delivery was fast too, the only issue was that he went to the wrong place because he read my address wrong. He even acknowledged his mistake that he read it wrong and sorry for the delay. Admitting mistakes for a delivery guy, that almost never happens.
author: Rohan D.

description: i went and order a slice they put 12 pieces of sausage on a slice the chinese girl was looking at ppl crazy amd was not professional with the service long story short i asked her to alice the pizze slice after a cit a piece off my slice she said she could not because i ate off it ok i get it but there is soap and water there right!!!!!  ask for a box cause i didnt like it and was taking it to my son to share with his girlfriend and ahe said it xost ok i get that to but i put the big slice on the plate that was falling off and in the bad and the whole alice fell on the ground she disnt offer me another slice and chared me a extra dollar without telling be i sigh a recipt for 4.33$ and was charged 5.33 for a nasty bland slice no flavor on sauce ! i jad to add extra oregano peppers and parmesan to get a little kick long story short they copied da javu pizza amd they. this place is nothing like it never againwill i refer thos place amim big on referring ppl!
author: billy b.

description: Fast, convenient delivery. Made the order from the Yelp App
author: Andrew A.

description: We ordered from Supreme Pizza for the first time recently and were happy.  It was a Friday night, around 6:30pm, and our delivery arrived within 40 minutes of placing the order (we live just a few blocks away).  We got the "San Franciscan," which was quite good.  The edges of the crust weren't as soft as we would have liked, but overall, we were pleased and intend to order from them again. (The leftovers tasted good the next day, too!)
author: Barnali D.

description: The pizza are amazing! Is one of my favorite pizza place in the city! Me and group of friends would always come here every lunch the staff are really friendly and the pizzas a re big. One pizza will make you full. Hawaiian is simply the best. Can't wait to come back and eat here again!
author: Chanel E.

description:
We ordered a pizza using a delivery service.  An hour later, we checked, and our order was canceled (by them).  

So we ordered from Seniores instead.  Not much else I can say.
author: Salem S.

description:
Highest rank.

Definition of "supreme": http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/supreme?r=75&src=ref&ch=dic

Definition of five stars: Made to order slices for $3 with light cheese, an impressive amount of BBQ chicken for $0.50 more and served so big it's more like two slices.

Great stuff.
author: Jason B.

description: Ordered a Hawaiian pizza for delivery (free delivery!) and the pizza tasted great and the delivery guy was really nice. Overall very happy I ordered from them :)
author: Adriana H.

description:
Pizza Love is out and Supreme Pizza is in!

The old pizza place is under new management. They made a lot of GREAT changes to their menu - basically threw everything out. The best things about the pizza are the crust and the cheese. The crust is thin, light, and flavorful. The cheese is nice and gooey. I've tried two types of pizza so far. The Prima and the Margarita. Both were delish. The only thing I didn't really like about the Margarita (and this is REALLY small) is that the tomatoes were chopped and not sliced - kind of messed with the balance of flavors. Other than that, the pizza was really delish! I've only tried the individual slices, but look forward to trying a whole pie and the wide range of salads and pastas. Be prepared to spend about a buck or two more than you would spend at other area pizza joints.
author: Barbara W.

description: Love this corner Mission pizza joint.. A BIG slice if heaven!  My slice was made to order with mushrooms, linguica, and red onions, and I love the airy dough bubbles in the crust ... reminds me of a little Italian place from my childhood. The space is open, clean with lots of light and sunshine. I also liked the flowers in the window. There are lots of options for toppings, and calzones too.  You also could add basil, oregano, Parmesan YUM!  The bacon salad looked good too..have to come back!!  Great hangout to watch the game too.. The 49ers were winning on my visit ( Go Niners!! ). I will definitely be back!
author: Ingrid N.

description:
what i ordered... classic pizza

pizza was great in size with lots of toppings but it stops there..... crust was tasteless, sausage was stale, olives were of low quality and the sauce tasted like fresh from an opened can.

ambiance... ok (a bit cluttered)
service... good (cashier was nice)
cost... $$ (fair)
author: Gors P.

description: Got two slices of pepperoni and love the ratio of crust to non-crust. I am going back to this place.
author: Brandon C.

description: Great pizza, great service, and the delivery is always on time. I highly recommend it!
author: Ingrid O.

description: Ordered at 7:30 on a Saturday night.  Arrived within 45mins and we're a 20 min drive from their location! The BFs classic calzone was f'ing fantastic (his words). I got 2 HUUUUGE pieces of pizza. Together they were about a half an Xlarge pizza! Lots of fresh veggies, decent crust, needed more sauce IMO. Overall, great!
author: Emily K.

description: I ordered a (simple) slice of pizza and was told it would be ten minutes. 30 minutes later I am still sitting waiting for my slice to be ready. There was no line and it was not the lunch rush. No wonder this place is always empty.
author: Maryam M.

description: great varieties but too much cheese ! gosh ! great for people who like their food quite americanish and cheesy !
author: Bhaskara C.

description:
I rarely write bad reviews...but wow...this place really earned it.

Complete incompetence.  Lucas who took my order shat the bed and was completely unapologetic.

After being told my order would take 45min-60 min...I patiently waited 1 hour and 15 minutes and called back to check on it. I was then told that my order "was not on the books..". Apparently that means it was never taken down...which is crazy b/c I paid using a groupon.  

I ordered, gave all of my contact info...and was simply told - "yeah...we don't have it...it's really busy". Neither the words "I'm sorry" nor any the sense of empathy were presented...nor was a solution.  

He would not even offer to quickly make me my order...I said, what should I do about my dinner...he just said it would be at least 35 min.

F this poorly managed establishment and cheers to anyone who can tolerate dealing with garbage service. 

Serrano's, Patxi's, and Escape From NY all deliver and provide FAR superior customer service.

PS I asked for the manager to call me back...he did, but only after I'd ordered another pizza. He was apologetic. 1 star for the manager showing some level of caring.
author: Lance T.

description: Generous portions.  Very friendly prices.  Delivery always comes right on time or even 10-20 mins early (always appreciated when you're stuck in the office and starving).  Also last time I ordered from them they included ranch dressing with my pizza for whatever reason.  I had never thought to dip pizza in ranch dressing before, but hey, since it was there...a revelation!  Thanks, Supreme!
author: Leith M.

description:
I've been sick all weekend, so I decided to take the easy route for dinner...ordered pizza through EAT24.  After an hour they claimed it was out for delivery, just 10 more minutes.  Hour and a half and it's still "out for delivery." Two hours and I cancel the order through EAT24.  Two hours and 40 minutes after I ordered I get a call that the delivery guy is outside if I want to come get it.
They are always late but this is ridiculous...and they never actually come to the door.  Never again!
author: rebecca s.

description: This place is alright. The ingredients seemed to be good and the pizza was hot and the crust was crisp. So why 3 stars? It just wasn't anything special. Personally I like Costco better. FYI I got the Hawaiian and San Franciscan. Slices are huge so that's nice.
author: Tony P.

description: I ordered on eat 24. They had it ready to go when I got there and it was super quick. I ordered a classic calzone. The ingredients were good quality. It was stuffed full and quite delicious. The dough has good flavor but isn't overpowering. I ate it like a sandwich and it was messy and gooey as any good calzone should be. I'm really pleased with my first order here and will definitely be back. Thanks for a fast and delicious dinner!
author: Justin D.

description: Not so supreme if you ask me. The crust was doughy and the topping so-so. The Cesar salad looked anemic and tasted like something from the Olive Garden.  Sorry guys, it's back to Pauline's, Gialinas or even the Precita Park Cafe pizza which blew this one out if the stadium.
author: Nigel P.

description: Its local, its fresh, and its fast!!! Nobody knows about this late night gem, but they are made to order fast and fresh pizza and calzones that rival places you wait in line for. The price is on point and the service is friendly and friendly. If you are in the area and looking for quick grub or pizza, look no further than supreme pizza. As always, I recomend the hawaiian!
author: Jake C.

description: Went here for lunch to try a slice and the slices are huge!  Lot cleaner then before and taste better.  I tried there plain cheese slice and it was great.  Will come back to try other variety.  But I was sold on the cheese slice.
author: Michael L.

description: Quick, reasonably priced & made fresh! Great for a meal on the go. The Margherita slice is my favorite and fills me up every time.
author: Christa C.

description: Alright. I have tried to give this place the benefit of the doubt for months now. Basically because they are cheap and near by. But after today...I'm done with them. In the past few months they have messed up my orders completely...have not brought the right stuff....or will be out of stuff and just send other shit in it's place hoping I don't notice. One...that's completely shady. Two, it shows you are afraid of losing a sale and would rather just send other stuff....than calling and owning up to your lack of inventory. Your breadsticks should be taken off the menu since you NEVER have them and tell your staff to get their shit in order. You as a small business will only survive so long on this shitty service before word gets out and people go elsewhere. Remember...you work in a very dense and competitive food market...if you don't rectify these problems of your's soon...you won't have a business much longer. Sincerely...disgruntled yelper. You have lost my business forever to Serrano's and even your more expensive competition due to your incompetence.
author: Mr. Potato G.

description: I like the crust, and they 'made my slice to order'...took 10 minutes it was worth it.I got cheese only: thin, crispy crust with great texture, sauce had good flavor, overall a great value for $3!
author: Michael O.

description: Loved it, I ordered the hot wing an a slice of pizza. One slice was like two slices (awesome) an the wings were fresh an moist yummy. First time ordering an id defiantly order again!!
author: Marla M.

description:
could not be more excited about a place with such a low delivery minimum aaaand pizza by the slice for delivery!
so perfect for when i'm home alone and don't want a pizza to myself!!!
author: Chantel B.

description: Great slice!  Ask them to only put one side of crust before ordering.  Employees are really nice. they have great condiments to dress your pizza. Great place...enjoy!
author: Vik M.

description: Yummy pizza with a variety of toppings and a pizza parlor like atmosphere (though the TV is in an inconvenient location to actually watch...). The pizza is delicious and is made fresh and comes out piping hot - though at upwards of $4.50 a slice you can do much better in the area.
author: Gentry B.

description: Their pizza is GREAT, cheap, and delivery is fast. Always reliable. Happy customer! They have never made a mistake and drivers are always nice.
author: Christine K.

description: My first ever order.. Mentioned RANCH PLEASE, pizza arrived late, and shocker, no ranch.  Not a good first experience,
author: Timothy P.

description: The San Franciscan was amazing. Tasted like it was made with fresh ingredients and had a great thick crust. The service was fast and the delivery man was extremely polite and helpful!
author: Meghan O.

description: Took 1hr and 20 min to deliver-...pizza arrived cold-...wrong toppings-...and none of the sauces I ordered. Terrible, never ordering from here again.
author: Max B.

description: Their service was good and so was the pizza! I had to order pizza for a group of volunteers at the San Francisco Food Bank and these guys delivered the pizza on time. I had read some bad reviews so I took extra caution and reminded them that we needed the pizza on time as this was a group event and they really delivered what they promised. Thanks Supreme Pizza!
author: Kay T.

description: I just order my pizza greatest pizza ever thanks guys for making my last pregant days so happy
author: Dolores B.
